Title: 35836 - Adventuring Outwards: # Charming London Villages
Direction: 500 words. Discuss 3-6 of London's minor villages, which each possess their own unique aesthetic and charm. Discuss why the reader may want to depart from their cozy central London hotel, to visit these smaller, more quaint destinations. Explain that exploring these villages will enhance the readers understanding of London and offer them unusual things to do that simply won't be found in the city. Your audience includes people interested in travel ages 18-45, possibly a focus on female readers. Talk about leaving behind your beautiful London hotel to explore even more beauty when connecting the AT. Music is prolific throughout London, so find something music-related in one of the villages, then talk about it in relation to other musical places in London to connect the secondary client link.
Extra Writer Notes: This article will also link to an article called "# Most Music Related Places to Visit in London." Please bold the anchor text you would like to use for this link.

Title: 35838 - # Iconic Album Cover Locations in London
Direction: 500 words: List 3-6 locations in London that have been featured on famous album covers. Discuss where you can find these famous spots and why they are influential. You can include the secondary client link anywhere in the article when discussing music related locations in London. The main client link can be included when discussing hotel accommodations when you visit London. Your audience consists of future travelers to London.
